content.prompt: Which of the following best explains the movement of women into the teaching profession in the nineteenth century?

choices.label: The increasing professionalization of nonindustrial jobs pushed men away from teaching positions.
The education of children in schools was increasingly seen as a respectable occupation for women.
The teaching profession was becoming increasingly open to working-class women.
The use of domestic paid labor declined over the course of the century.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
